newsitem.title: PERU: Lima stocks end higher on bargain-buying.
newsitem.headline: Lima stocks end higher on bargain-buying.

text.p: Lima shares closed moderately higher on bargain-hunting in a session overshadowed by a large cross of benchmark Telefonica del Peru.
Brokers saw stable trading at the beginning of next week, with attractively low prices and companies' good perspectives possibly producing some rises.

On Friday, the General Index .IGRA rose 0.76 percent to 1,406.80 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index .ISEL gained 1.16 percent to 1,922.25. Total volume was 174 million soles ($70.5 million) in 2,419 operations, with 37 stocks rising, 44 flat and 19 falling.
Telefonica accounted for 84.5 percent of trade, mainly due to a 25.65 million share cross by local brokerage Bolsa Wiese at the stocks's closing price of 5.58 soles.
Telefonica rose 1.82 percent during the session on total trade of 26.36 million shares.
Brokers said investors were attracted on Friday by low prices, particularly in the brewery sector.

"The shares in the brewery sector, so representative of the market, were already attractive due to various days of falls which encouraged investors to take long-term positions," said Augusto Larco, of Peruval brokerage.
Brokers added that the electricity sector had slowed its aggressive trading on Friday but this did not represent a weakening of investor interest in those shares.
"The electricity shares did not move like previous sessions, but that does not mean there is no interest, there are still buyers," said Pablo Navarro, of Fortuna brokerage.

Brewery Compania Nacional de Cerveza led Friday's gains with a 5.06 percent rise to 0.83 soles on 316,323 shares, while Cervecera Backus y Johnston was up 2.08 percent to 2.45 soles on 775,435 shares and Cervesur gained 1.60 soles on 226,558 shares.
Electricity company Edegel gained 3.1 percent to 3.44 soles, while Luz del Sur closed flat on 3.60 soles.
